content.text:
Permitted principal uses. Permitted principal uses
in the R-3 Quarter-Acre Residence District shall be as follows:

Single-family dwelling with only one housekeeping
unit.

Lot area and building requirements for principal uses.
Lot area and building requirements for principal uses shall be as
follows:
Minimum lot area: 10,000 square feet.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007; 8-24-2010]

Minimum lot width: The minimum lot width shall be
90 feet or the prevailing lot width, whichever is greater.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007; 8-24-2010]
Minimum lot frontage: 30 feet.

Front yard: The minimum front yard shall be 30 feet
or the prevailing front yard setback, whichever is greater.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007]
Minimum rear yard: 25 feet.
Minimum side yard: 15 feet each.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007]
(Reserved)[1]

content.footnote:
[1]
Editor’s Note: Former Subsection B(7), regarding the
minimum aggregate width of both side yards, as amended, was repealed
8-24-2010.

content.text:
Minimum building size: 960 square feet of living space
of which 720 shall be on the first floor.

Maximum height: 2 1/2 stories and in no event exceed
30 feet.[Amended 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007]
Maximum coverage: 20%.
No structure shall project outside the sky exposure plane specified at § 280-45R(2).[Added 5-8-2007; amended 8-28-2007]

The maximum interior floor area of a single-family
dwelling shall not exceed 1 1/2 times the maximum lot coverage,
as expressed in square feet.[Added 5-8-2007; amended 8-28-2007]
Permitted accessory uses. Same as § 280-55C(1), (2), (3), (4) and (9) for the R-1 District.
Lot area and building requirements for accessory uses.

Maximum height: one story, and in no event shall exceed
14 feet to the ridgeline above surrounding grade; such garages shall
be designed with a gabled roof.[Amended 1-25-1983; 6-28-2005]

Maximum accessory building or garage door height:
eight feet.

Maximum accessory building or garage wall height:
nine feet.

Maximum land coverage: 10% (accessory building or
garage limited to 500 square feet).[Amended 1-25-1983]
Minimum distance to rear property line: three feet.
Minimum distance to front property line: 65 feet.
Minimum distance to side property line: three feet.[2]

content.footnote:
[2]
Editor's Note: Former Subsection D(6), establishing
the minimum distance to corner side property line, which immediately
followed this subsection, was repealed 5-8-2007; 8-28-2007.

content.text: Special uses permitted at the discretion of the Planning Board. Same as § 280-55E(2), (3), (4), (5) and (6) for the R-1 District.
Parking and loading.
Off-street parking requirements: same as for R-1 District.
Off-street loading requirements: same as for R-1 District.
